title: Is my LLC protected from personal bancruptcy?
question: I am having to declare chapter 7 bankruptcy due to excessive personal debt. I am a 40% member of an LLC, which provides a paycheck and little ele. The business is essentially break even. I want to shield the business and my partners from the bankruptcy. What protection does an LLC have from personal bankruptcy? What could cause problems for the business?
question_tags: LLC (limited liability company),Bankruptcy,Chapter 7 bankruptcy,Bankruptcy trustee,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt
answers:
Most LLC operating agreements state that the LLC is dissolved upon the filing of bankruptcy by one of its members. The reason is, take your chapter 7 for example, the bankruptcy trustee will gather your assets, which includes your ownership interest in the LLC. Now the LLC members have a "partner" they never intended.
